beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Length. 4 out of 5. Bring real food. Not just gels. Four distance options from 18 to 100 miles means everyone finds their suffering sweet spot. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Moving 5,500 riders through rural Barry County without major disasters is impressive enough. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Michigan spring weather guarantees you won't know what you're getting until race morning - could be snow, mud, dust, or ice. Prestige. 3 out of 5. Established race. Solid reputation. The 'world's largest gravel road race' title carries weight when you're talking 5,500 riders and $40k in cash prizes. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Well-run race. Professional touches throughout. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. 70 kegs of Founders Brewery and a festival atmosphere make for a proper post-race celebration. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. $119 for 100 miles with $40k in total prize money and a massive post-race party is fair market rate.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: 100-Mile Michigan Farmland Festival. If you want a 100+ mile challenge with large field and festival atmosphere. yes, it's a fun event. If you want terrain variety or pro field depth. look elsewhere.
